Si usted o alguien que conoce necesita ayuda, visite https://bit.ly/36gykON pic.twitter.com/dyUZkCEGaT

¿Necesita reponer su receta durante la emergencia? Póngase en contacto con su proveedor médico o visite uno dentro de la misma cadena. Si esa no es una opción, traiga el recipiente con su nombre y la dosis del medicamento. En todo caso, traiga su identificación. #KincadeFire

Need to refill your prescription during the emergency? Contact your medical provider to request a refill or, visit one within the same chain. If that’s not an option, bring the container showing your name and medication dose. In all cases, bring your identification. #KincadeFire

Apoye las víctimas con una donación financiera, pueden usar según lo necesiten. Por favor, asistir las organizaciones que ya estan envolucrados. Alimentos, ropa, y artículos de hogar no se pueden aceptar en este momento, se pueden agobiar los esfuerzos. https://bit.ly/2PExdT1

Support victims with a financial donation, which they can use as they need. Please give to relief organizations already engaged in the response. Food, clothing and household items are not being accepted at this time as they can overwhelm relief efforts.https://bit.ly/2PExdTl

For the next few days, overnight temperatures are expected to drop into the 30s. Since many residents will be without power, they should follow cold weather safety tips found at: https://socoemergency.org/cold-weather-code-blue-advisory/ …pic.twitter.com/45YICwyOf4

Alimentos y medicamentos refrigerados pueden ser inseguros si no hay electricidad por más de 4 horas. Puede haberse calentado y debe desecharse. La Supervisora @lyndajbhopkins ofrece consejos sobre seguridad alimentaria http://bit.ly/2WrcQKx Información:http://bit.ly/322Scl4

Food and refrigerated medicine may be unsafe if the power is out for more than 4 hours. It may have become warm and should be disposed of. Sonoma County Supervisor @lyndajbhopkins offers advice on food safety http://bit.ly/2WrcQKx More info at http://bit.ly/322Scl4

PG&E corto el gas a 23,000 clientes para proteger sus hogares del incendio. Incluye las ciudades de Cloverdale a Fulton y Forestville y mas conexiones si es necesario. Cloverdale fue incluida porque las líneas de servicio a la ciudad pasan por el área del incendio.https://twitter.com/wsreports/status/1188545655381250048 …

PG&E shut down gas to about 23,000 customers to protect homes from fire. This includes Cloverdale to Fulton and town of Forestville. They will shut off other connections as needed. Cloverdale was included because lines servicing the city pass through the burn area.https://twitter.com/wsreports/status/1188545655381250048 …

La línea de ayuda para gente afectada por desastres esta diseñada para ayudar a quienes sufran crisis emocionales relacionadas a desastres naturales o causados por humanos. Llame al 1-800-985-5990 y presione "2" o envíe un msj de texto al 66746 para hablar con un concejero.

The Disaster Distress Helpline, 1-800-985-5990, is a hotline dedicated to providing immediate crisis counseling for people who are experiencing emotional distress related to any natural or human-caused disaster. You can also text 66746 to connect with a trained crisis counselor.

Si su hogar pierde energía, ¿cómo sabe qué alimentos puede conservar y comer de manera segura? Si no está seguro de cuánto tiempo la temperatura ha estado a 40 ° F (o 0 ° F para congeladores), ¡en caso de duda, tírelo! Para obtener información visitehttps://socoemergency.org/home/emergency/health/sabio-de-comida-es-comida-segura/ …

If your home loses power, how do you know what foods you can safely keep and eat? If you’re unsure how long the temperature has been at or above 40 °F (or 0°F for freezers), "When In Doubt, Throw It OUT"! For more information visithttps://socoemergency.org/home/emergency/health/food-wise-is-food-safe/ …

Por favor asegurene que los generadores esten instalados correctamente y operado al aire libre. Operando un generador de gas en el interior podria provocar envenenamiento por monoxide de carbon y/o un incendio.pic.twitter.com/zTuQKZ3QW9
Please ensure that generators are properly installed and operated outdoors. Operating a gas generator inside could lead to carbon monoxide poisoning and/or a fire.pic.twitter.com/mwe1nHBylT

El PSPS de PG&E está en marcha por todo el Condado de Sonoma. Siga estos consejos de seguridad de tránsito: acérquese a intersecciones con precaución, trate las señales de tránsito que no funcionan como señales de alto, reduzca su velocidad y esté atento siempre.pic.twitter.com/Z7EwRQ8E2C

PG&E’s Public Safety Power Shutoff (PSPS) throughout Sonoma County is underway. Follow these traffic safety tips for your commute: approach intersections w/caution, treat non-working traffic signals as stop signs, reduce speed & be aware of your surroundings.pic.twitter.com/OaKveYXqIw

Debido a la Vigilancia de Incendios Climáticos del Servicio Meteorológico Nacional, PG&E está considerando un corte de energía en partes de aproximadamente 30 condados, incluyendo el Condado de Sonoma. Estamos monitoreando activamente la situación.pic.twitter.com/N5Y27X1Yh6

Due to National Weather Service's Fire Weather Watch, PG&E is considering a safety shutdown off power across portions of about 30 counties including Sonoma County. We are actively monitoring the situation.pic.twitter.com/xFOMol3H5b

A Red Flag Warning has been issued by the National Weather Service for the North Bay mountains above 1,000 feet, beginning 8:00 pm Saturday, October 5, through 10:00 am Sunday, October 6. Northeast winds 10-20 mpg, high humidity. Please don't create outdoor sparks or fires.
5/5 Puede revisar si usted será impactado por un apagón de PG&E usando su dirección aquí: https://www.pge.com/ …/wildfires/psps-service-impact-map.page
4/5 También puede tomar acción actualizando su información de contacto con PG&E por internet https://www.pge.com/ …/…/update-your-contact-information.page o por teléfono en español: 1-866-743-6589

3/5 Encuentre información en español sobre como preparase para un apagón aquí: https://socoemergency.org/ …/power-shutof…/cortes-de-energia/ Asegúrese de estar registrado para recibir alertas de emergencia enhttp://www.socoalert.org

2/5 PG&E elevo el riesgo de un corte eléctrico planeado. El Condado de Sonoma continuará monitoreando la situación muy de cerca para responder apropiadamente. Sin embargo, la decisión de cortar la electricidad y la rapidez con la que se restaura el servicio es exclusiva de PG&E.

1/5 El Servicio Nacional de Meteorología emitió una advertencia de Bandera Roja para la noche del sábado (10/5) /mañana del domingo (10/6). Experimentaremos vientos de entre 10 a 20 millas por hora (mph)con ráfagas de hasta 40 mph.pic.twitter.com/8zRm3B8rvF
5/5 You can check if you could be impacted by a PG&E power shutoff using your address here: https://www.pge.com/ …/wildfires/psps-service-impact-map.page ****
4/5 You can also take action by updating your contact information with PG&E online https://www.pge.com/ …/…/update-your-contact-information.page or by phone at 1-866-743-6589.
3/5 Find information on how to prepare here: https://socoemergency.org/home/prepare/power-shutoffs/ … Make sure you are signed up to receive emergency alerts: http://www.socoalert.org

2/5 PG&E has elevated the risk of a power shutoff. The County of Sonoma is following the situation closely to respond appropriately. Although, the decision to shut down the power and the speed at which it is restored comes solely from PG&E

1/5 The National Weather Service has issued a Red Flag Warning for this Saturday (10/5) night/Sunday (10/6) morning. The winds will be in the 10-20 MPH range with gusts up to 40.pic.twitter.com/4teTZAB75g

The only money that should be turned over to the County is insurance proceeds designated for debris removal, less any reimbursable expenses for additional debris removal or for repairs to property caused by the debris removal process. More information: http://www.sonomacoutyrecovers.org

Update for Fire Survivors: (1/2) Many fire survivors have received copies of invoices sent to their insurance company for the Government-Sponsored Debris Removal work by FEMA. PROPERTY OWNERS ARE NOT RESPONSIBLE FOR THE FULL AMOUNT OF THE INVOICE.pic.twitter.com/VXDVdqCXl1

The County of Sonoma has started collecting insurance funds for debris removal on behalf of FEMA & CalOES. We are sending each property owner an email with a personal link to an online account that contains documents related to the debris removal process. https://tinyurl.com/y5alxf6c pic.twitter.com/wC9WqJkNvd
Update / Actualización [9/25 - 4PM]: Power has been fully restored in Sonoma County. Restauraron la electricidad completamente en el Condado de Sonoma.pic.twitter.com/335twVUp9y

Actualización de PG&E: Las condiciones del clima han mejorado y cuadrillas están inspeccionando equipos para determinar que tan rápido se puede restaurar el servicio. Se espera restaurar el servicio completamente el 25 de sept., mientras no cambie el resultado de las inspecciones

@PGE4Me update: [9/25 - 2PM] Weather conditions have now improved and crews are inspecting equipment to determine how quickly we can safely restore service. Pending the result of our patrols, we expect service to be fully restored on September 25th.

(( 9/24 - 11pm)) PG&E will open a Community Resource Center at the Santa Rosa Veterans building (1351 Maple Ave) from 8 am to 6 pm tomorrow 9/25 ** PG&E abrirá Centro de Recursos Comunitario en el edifico de veteranos de Santa Rosa (1351 Maple Ave) de 8 am a 6 pm mañana 25 sept

Información del Distrito de Bomberos del Condado de Sonoma: Estaremos realizando quemas de entrenamiento durante los siguientes 7 días cerca de Sanders Rd. al norte del Aeropuerto del Condado. Tenemos medidas de control en efecto. Esperen ver humo desde varias aéreas del Condado.

Per Sonoma County Fire District: "We will be conducting training burns over the next 7 days off Sanders Rd. north of the Sonoma County Airport. Control measures in place. Expect to see smoke from various areas of the County."

¡No se deje engañar por el hielo negro! La nieve derretida, las carreteras mojadas y las bajas temperaturas contribuyen a que se forme el hielo negro y este hace que las carreteras se vuelvan resbalosas, especialmente los puentes y rampas. Más info: https://www.weather.gov/safety/winter-spanish …pic.twitter.com/gaZyaNRUos

Do not be misled by black ice! The melting snow/ wet roads & the low temperatures can result in the formation of black ice. Black ice is difficult to see and makes roads very slippery, especially bridges & overpasses. Drive safe! More info: http://weather.gov/winter #WinterSafetypic.twitter.com/ysE3Lnocye

IMPORTANTE: Se extiende acción ejecutiva que mantiene la prohibición del aumento de precios de alquiler en situaciones de emergencia hasta el 31 de mayo de 2019. Incluye los Condados de Sonoma, Napa, Mendocino, Lake, Santa Barbara, Shasta, Siskiyou y Ventura. No se deje engañar.pic.twitter.com/Rknv4JMtoP

IMPORTANT: On Wednesday, Governor Jerry Brown issued an executive order that extends the state’s prohibition on price gouging during emergencies. It'll remain in effect until May 31, 2019 for the Counties of Sonoma Napa, Mendocino, Lake, Santa Barbara, Shasta, Siskiyou & Ventura.pic.twitter.com/8Mqe572DpI

SoCoAlert Subscribers: We recommend you save this number 866-419-5000 in your contacts. That is the number that you will be receiving calls from in an emergency. We also suggest saving it under "favorites" so the calls will go through even if you are on “Do not disturb” mode.

dispatching, EMS, military, or other scanner, or public safety related things. We post all our updates here but also to Facebook (@SCScanner) and Instagram (@SonomaScanner) If you have any tips or suggestions, (3/4)

When an Evacuation Warning happens, be prepared to “Go!” Place your emergency supply kit in your vehicle, keep your pets nearby, and ensure your family is ready to leave at a moment’s notice. There's a science to timber harvesting! Trees are chosen for harvest based upon forest levels, density, spacing, insect & disease conditions, log market value, specific regeneration method for the trees, reforestation need, & strategic fuelbreak & fuel-loading concerns. #LovingCApic.twitter.com/oc7vSKiTVM

Timber harvesting creates resiliency to fire, insects, and disease by reducing overstocked forest conditions. Young children have very sensitive skin, which means that bath water too hot can scald them very quickly. Always check the water temperature before bathing to avoid burns. Bath temperature for babies & children is best between 95°–98° #RubberDuckDay #NationalBathSafetyMonthpic.twitter.com/bcK7FNg1ES

#IndoorDefensibleSpace is just as important as the defensible space you maintain outdoors. These simple rules for your living room can help make sure that your warm and cozy fireplace doesn’t become a fire hazard! Click here for a #HomeFireSafety checklist http://www.readyforwildfire.org/docs/files/File/Checklist.pdf …pic.twitter.com/Z91zN5mk2Y

The idea of creating #IndoorDefensibleSpace for your home need not “puzzle” you. Tune in during the month of January to pick up tips on how to keep your family fire safe & warm during these cold winter months. For more information on #HomeFireSafety visit http://www.readyforwildfire.org/docs/files/File/Checklist.pdf …pic.twitter.com/0yrVvLy04u

Although The Board of Forestry has seen several reinventions over the past century, what remains is the dedication to enforcing forest & fire laws. From all of us at CAL FIRE, we want to wish you and your loved ones a happy and fire safe holiday!pic.twitter.com/XUgNtv2jZ7

Cooking a festive feast for the family is not always perfect. For those times that your holiday meal doesn’t go as planned, make sure there is a fire extinguisher nearby. #FireSafe4TheHoliday #12DaysOfSafety http://calfire.ca.gov/communications/communications_firesafety_holiday …pic.twitter.com/6jOlrikMRJ

Little hands can easily grab a hold of a pot handle if left outward on a stove. Don’t let the excitement of Christmas dinner be ruined by a kitchen accident! Avoid a dangerous situation by keeping all pot handles turned inward. #12DaysOfSafety http://calfire.ca.gov/communications/communications_firesafety_holiday …pic.twitter.com/kOkQEybuHF

Looking to stay warm from the cold winter air by snuggling near a crackling fireplace? The most important #FireSafe4TheHoliday rule is never leave a fire unattended! This of course includes those warm and inviting fireplaces. #12DaysOfSafety http://calfire.ca.gov/communications/communications_firesafety_holiday …pic.twitter.com/L9FlJt2jSB

Be #FireSafe4TheHoliday by testing your carbon monoxide alarms. Ensure your family is alerted to the invisible danger that can be caused by running fuel burning appliances. #12DaysOfSafety http://calfire.ca.gov/communications/communications_firesafety_holiday …pic.twitter.com/HPT0SQ44bX

Driving to meet up with your family for Christmas? Drive carefully because winter conditions make for even more dangers on the road. #12DaysOfSafety http://calfire.ca.gov/communications/communications_firesafety_holiday …pic.twitter.com/rDUXbhbsXH

Smoke alarms are extremely important all year long but during the holidays you want to be certain they are in working order. A cooking mishap can easily lead to a fire, so be #FireSafe4TheHoliday and test them before the festivities begin! #12DaysOfSafety http://calfire.ca.gov/communications/communications_firesafety_holiday …pic.twitter.com/orpcf80gRE

Nothing says Christmas like twinkling lights, but leaving them on for prolonged periods of time or unattended can bring about unforeseen fire dangers. Flipping the switch off when you are not around can make your home #FireSafe4TheHoliday. #12DaysOfSafety http://calfire.ca.gov/communications/communications_firesafety_holiday …pic.twitter.com/jvzwOV8Rf7

Christmas trees are a staple of holiday decorating but a dry tree can quickly become a fire hazard. Be #FireSafe4TheHoliday by never letting the water level go below the bottom of the trunk. This moisture can increase fire resistance. #12DaysOfSafety http://calfire.ca.gov/communications/communications_firesafety_holiday …pic.twitter.com/PZzSgrqG9Y

An easy switch to make your home #FireSafe4TheHoliday is using LED candles instead of traditional candles. This is a quick way to prevent a potential disaster and still keep an inviting glow for your holiday guests. #12DaysOfSafety http://calfire.ca.gov/communications/communications_firesafety_holiday …pic.twitter.com/mYmP1ULphk

Attention to detail is everything when it comes to putting up the perfect holiday decorations. Don’t let that stop at being #FireSafe4TheHoliday! Remember indoor and outdoor lights are different and should stay in their proper area. #12DaysOfSafety http://calfire.ca.gov/communications/communications_firesafety_holiday …pic.twitter.com/axFex73g5R

Part of being #FireSafe4TheHoliday is being mindful of where those fun and festive decorations are placed around your home. In case of an emergency you want to be sure that you and your loved ones can easily exit your home. #12DaysOfSafety http://calfire.ca.gov/communications/communications_firesafety_holiday …pic.twitter.com/78pNmZiPiz

Stay #FireSafe4TheHoliday by tuning in to our #12DaysOfSafety messages that begin today! To start, we recommend keeping a minimum distance of three feet between Christmas trees and any source of heat. http://calfire.ca.gov/communications/communications_firesafety_holiday …pic.twitter.com/85lo2FSvRF

Ensure you are properly disposing of ashes created by your fireplace or wood burning stove. Place ashes in a bucket made of non-flammable material, and only store that bucket on concrete or bare mineral soil. A deck can catch fire from transferred heat. #FireplaceSafetypic.twitter.com/Cwm3kW0wYS
